title: US Strike Sinks Suspected Drug Vessel in Caribbean, Two Dead
snippets: Exclusive: US returning Caribbean strike survivors to Colombia and Ecuador, Trump says Reuters
The latest attack is at least the sixth US strike on ships in waters off Venezuela in recent weeks.
US will send survivors of strike on suspected drug vessel back to Ecuador and Colombia, Trump says AP News
It is unclear if the two surviving alleged drug smugglers have any links to Venezuelan criminal organizations.
Trump confirms U.S. strike sank drug sub in Caribbean killing two as survivors face repatriation and legal concerns over military action grow.
Trump Says US to Return Survivors of Boat Strike to Home Countries Bloomberg.com
titles: Exclusive: US returning Caribbean strike survivors to Colombia and Ecuador, Trump says - Reuters
US to repatriate survivors of strike on 'drug-carrying submarine', Trump says
US will send survivors of strike on suspected drug vessel back to Ecuador and Colombia, Trump says - AP News
U.S. repatriating survivors of alleged drug boat strike to Colombia, Ecuador
US will send survivors of strike on suspected drug vessel back to Ecuador and Colombia, Trump say
Trump Says US to Return Survivors of Boat Strike to Home Countries - Bloomberg.com
summary: The US conducted a strike on a suspected drug vessel in the Caribbean, resulting in the sinking of the boat and the death of two individuals. President Trump confirmed that the survivors would be repatriated to their home countries, Ecuador and Colombia. This incident marks at least the sixth US strike on ships near Venezuela in recent weeks. The association of the two surviving alleged smugglers with Venezuelan criminal organizations remains uncertain. Concerns over the legality of the military action have been raised.

title: Millions in U.S. Protest Trump's Policies in Nationwide "No Kings" Demonstration
snippets: As 'No Kings' protests decry Trump, surveillance worries emerge Reuters
'No Kings' protesters emerge en masse for anti-Trump rallies Reuters
The demonstrations against the US president - which Republicans had called "hate America rallies" - were boisterous but peaceful.
Thousands converged on New York’s Times Square Saturday for a ‘No Kings’ protest against President Donald Trump.
More than 2,600 rallies are planned in cities large and small, organised by hundreds of coalition partners.

Millions attended the latest "No Kings" protests, which come as Trump has moved to deploy the National Guard in major cities. The US president is also targeting his political enemies. DW has the latest.
"No Kings" protests draw huge crowds across U.S. Axios
Republicans decry demonstrations as ‘anti-American’ as people voice opposition to administration’s hardline policies

Events scheduled in more than 2,700 towns and cities, aligning behind message that US is sliding into authoritarianism No Kings protest live: updates from around the US What to know about the anti-Trump protests attracting millions No Kings protests: in pictures Americans across all 50 states began
No Kings protests live: Anti-Trump demonstrators gather in New York, Washington and Chicago Reuters
Hundreds gathered in Vancouver for No Kings Day, part of a coordinated series of peaceful rallies focused on civic engagement and democratic participation
More than 2,500 rallies were planned in all 50 states.
titles: As 'No Kings' protests decry Trump, surveillance worries emerge - Reuters
'No Kings' protesters emerge en masse for anti-Trump rallies - Reuters
'No Kings' protests draw huge crowds as anti-Trump rallies sweep across US

Crowds gather for anti-Trump ‘No Kings’ protests across US
'No Kings' anti-Trump protests underway across US
"No Kings" protests draw huge crowds across U.S. - Axios

No Kings protests live: Anti-Trump demonstrators gather in New York, Washington and Chicago - Reuters

Anti-Trump ‘No Kings’ Rallies Begin In Thousands Of U.S. Cities (Photos)
summary: Millions of Americans participated in over 2,600 "No Kings" protests across all 50 states, voicing opposition to President Trump's policies and actions, including deploying the National Guard in cities and targeting political adversaries. Organized by hundreds of coalition partners, these demonstrations were described as peaceful, despite being criticized by some Republicans as "anti-American." The protests, emphasizing civic engagement and democratic participation, were a significant response to concerns over the country's slide into authoritarianism.

Max Verstappen stormed to pole position for the U.S. Grand Prix ahead of McLaren's Lando Norris, with championship leader Oscar Piastri struggling to sixth.

Lando Norris is second on grid, Oscar Piastri is sixth Max Verstappen won sprint after McLarens collided Max Verstappen claimed pole position for the US Grand Prix with an immense lap for Red Bull at the Circuit of the Americas. However the day was marked by yet another incident between the two worl
Max Verstappen stormed to pole position for the United States Grand Prix from Lando Norris despite missing out on a final run in Qualifying.

Verstappen takes pole ahead of Norris at U.S. GP
Verstappen takes F1 US GP pole after sprint victory to turn up heat on Norris and Piastri
Verstappen beats Norris to US GP pole as Piastri struggles to sixth
summary: Max Verstappen secured pole position for the United States Grand Prix, outperforming Lando Norris who placed second. Championship leader Oscar Piastri finished in sixth position. The qualifying session featured a notable performance from Verstappen and an incident involving the McLarens, but ultimately Verstappen led the grid.

title: Blue Jays' Springer Likely to Play in ALCS Game 6 vs Mariners, Manager Says
snippets: Blue Jays manager John Schneider says he's optimistic George Springer will be available against the Seattle Mariners in Game 6 of the AL Championship Series in Toronto on Sunday night.
George Springer is "feeling better" a day ahead of the most important game of the Toronto Blue Jays' post-season.

Baseball is as cruel as it is capricious. Which is why John Schneider isn’t dwelling on the “what-ifs” in Game 5 of the ALCS. Instead, he’s focused on the task ahead. “It’s part of the job and you move on and get ready for tomorrow.”

Blue Jays manager John Schneider told reporters on Saturday that Springer was “feeling a lot better than he did yesterday.” The 36-year-old had a CT scan on Friday night that confirmed there was no fracture, and Springer will be receiving treatment at Rogers Centre leading up to a win-or-go-home Gam
titles: Jays optimistic Springer to be available for Game 6
Jays’ Springer ‘feeling better’ ahead of Game 6
Blue Jays looking to learn from ‘what-ifs’ ahead of do-or-die Game 6
Schneider: Springer ‘feeling a lot better’ heading into Game 6 of ALCS after HBP
summary: Blue Jays manager John Schneider is optimistic that George Springer will play against the Seattle Mariners in Game 6 of the AL Championship Series in Toronto. Springer, feeling better after a CT scan showed no fracture, is receiving treatment ahead of the crucial game. Schneider is focused on preparing for the game, emphasizing the importance of moving forward and getting ready.

title: Israel Keeps Rafah Crossing Closed Indefinitely Amid Tensions with Hamas
snippets: Border crossing to stay closed, Israel says, as US alleges Hamas ceasefire violation Reuters
Israel says Rafah crossing to remain closed until further notice Reuters

Officials say reopening of gateway between Gaza and Egypt would depend on Hamas returning remains of dead hostages The Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt will stay closed “until further notice”, Israel has said, after the Palestinian embassy in Cairo said the territory’s sole gateway to th
The Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt will remain closed, Israel said, after the Palestinian embassy in Egypt said the sole gateway would reopen Monday.
titles: Border crossing to stay closed, Israel says, as US alleges Hamas ceasefire violation - Reuters
Israel says Rafah crossing to remain closed until further notice - Reuters
Rafah border crossing to stay closed ‘until further notice’, says Israel
Israel says Gaza’s Rafah crossing will remain closed, adding pressure over hostages’ remains
summary: Israel announced the Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt will remain closed "until further notice." This decision comes after the U.S. accused Hamas of violating a ceasefire and Israel stated the reopening would depend on Hamas returning the remains of dead hostages. The closure counters a previous statement from the Palestinian embassy in Egypt about the crossing's reopening.

The event saw McLaren drivers Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris both retire early after colliding on the first lap. SportsLine's Mike McClure had previously highlighted Verstappen, Norris, and Piastri as favorites. The BBC provided key coverage details for the Grand Prix weekend.

title: Bus Crash in Brazil Kills 17, Injures Several in Pernambuco
snippets: At least 17 people were killed and others injured after the driver of a bus lost control and crashed into a sand embankment, police said.

Driver lost control of bus in Saloá in Pernambuco state and cause of accident is under investigation A passenger bus in north-eastern Brazil has crashed into a sand embankment and flipped on its side, killing 17 people, local authorities have said. The bus was carrying about 30 passengers, police sa

SAO PAULO (AP) — A passenger bus in northeastern Brazil crashed into a sand embankment and flipped on its side, killing at least 17 people, authorities said Saturday. The bus was carrying about 30 passengers, police said. The number of injured, who were taken to nearby hospitals, was not immediately
titles: Brazil: Bus crash kills at least 17 people
Bus crashes in north-eastern Brazil, killing 17 people, say police
Passenger bus crash in northeastern Brazil leaves 17 dead
summary: In northeastern Brazil, a bus carrying around 30 passengers lost control and crashed into a sand embankment in Saloá, Pernambuco state, resulting in at least 17 fatalities. The incident also left several injured, who were transported to nearby hospitals. Authorities are currently investigating the cause of the accident.

title: Israel, Gaza Exchange Bodies; Outrage Over Unreturned Israeli Hostages
snippets: There is outrage in Israel that the armed group has not returned all deceased hostages from Gaza.
These were the updates on the ceasefire in Gaza for Saturday, October 18.

Israel has returned more Palestinian bodies in exchange for its own dead hostages. Meanwhile, Israelis are holding a large rally in Tel Aviv to call for the return of the deceased hostages. DW has more.
titles: Israel receives two bodies that Hamas says are Gaza hostages
Updates: Israel receives two more captives’ bodies from Gaza
Middle East: Israel returns bodies to Gaza after hostage ID'd
summary: On October 18, Israel and an armed group in Gaza exchanged bodies of the deceased, with Israel returning more Palestinian bodies for its own dead hostages. However, there is significant outrage in Israel over the armed group's failure to return all deceased Israeli hostages. This has prompted a large rally in Tel Aviv, where Israelis are demanding the return of all hostages. This event is part of the ongoing ceasefire updates in Gaza.

title: Broncos Activate Greenlaw, 49ers Activate Kittle from Injured Reserve
snippets: Kittle hasn't played since injuring his hamstring in the season opener

The Denver Broncos activated prized free agent acquisition Dre Greenlaw from injured reserve Saturday ahead of their game against the New York Giants on Sunday. Greenlaw has been sidelined since the summer with a quadriceps injury he first incurred during the team's offseason program. Defensive coor
The San Francisco 49ers activated star tight end George Kittle from injured reserve on Saturday after he had missed the past five games with a hamstring injury.
titles: George Kittle injury update: 49ers activate star TE off injured reserve ahead of Week 7 game vs. Falcons

49ers activate star tight end George Kittle from IR ahead of Falcons game
summary: The Denver Broncos activated Dre Greenlaw from injured reserve ahead of their game against the New York Giants, following his recovery from a quadriceps injury. Meanwhile, the San Francisco 49ers activated George Kittle from injured reserve after he missed five games due to a hamstring injury. Both players had been sidelined since their respective injuries, with Kittle's occurring in the season opener.

title: Iran's 10-Year Nuclear Deal Ends, Tehran Commits to Diplomacy

The JCPOA imposed significant restrictions on Iran, in exchange for sanctions relief, to prevent it from developing nuclear weapons.

Iran says it's no longer bound by nuclear deal limits
Iran says no longer bound by ‘restrictions’ on its nuclear program - Al Arabiya English
summary: The 10-year nuclear deal (JCPOA) between Iran and Western powers, which imposed restrictions on Iran's nuclear program in exchange for sanctions relief, has officially ended. Iran has stated it is no longer bound by the deal's restrictions, yet expresses a commitment to diplomacy.

title: Nobel Laureate Chen Ning Yang Passes Away at 103 in Beijing
snippets: Nobel laureate Chen Ning Yang dies at 103, Xinhua says Reuters

Renowned 1957 Nobel prize winner worked on statistical mechanics and symmetry principles in elementary particle physics Chen Ning Yang, one of the world’s most renowned physicists and a Nobel prize winner, died on Saturday in Beijing at the age of 103 after an illness, state media outlet Xinhua has
Chinese Nobel Prize-winning physicist Chen Ning Yang, one of the most influential scientists in modern physics, died in Beijing on Saturday. He was 103.

Chen Ning Yang, Chinese-American physicist and Nobel laureate, dies at 103
Chinese Nobel Prize-winning physicist Chen Ning Yang dies at 103
summary: Nobel laureate Chen Ning Yang, celebrated for his work in statistical mechanics and elementary particle physics, passed away at the age of 103 in Beijing due to illness, as reported by Xinhua. Yang, who won the Nobel Prize in 1957, was a pivotal figure in the field of modern physics.

title: Trump Commutes Ex-Rep. George Santos's Sentence for Fraud, Identity Theft
snippets: Trump commutes sentence of former US Rep. George Santos in federal fraud case AP News

US President Donald Trump commuted the prison sentence of disgraced former New York Congressman George Santos, who was serving a 7-year prison term for fraud and identity theft, and ordered his immediate release.
Trump said he began thinking about Santos after being reminded of a controversy about Democratic Sen. Richard Blumenthal's military service claims.
titles: Trump commutes sentence of former US Rep. George Santos in federal fraud case - AP News
Trump commutes prison sentence of ex-lawmaker George Santos
Trump commutes prison sentence of ex-GOP Rep. George Santos
summary: Former New York Republican Rep. George Santos, who was sentenced to over seven years in prison for wire fraud and identity theft, has had his sentence commuted by Donald Trump. Santos admitted to deceiving donors and stealing the identities of 11 people for campaign donations. Trump's decision to commute Santos's sentence was influenced by comparisons to controversies involving other politicians.

title: BNP Paribas Ordered to Pay $21M for Aiding Sudanese Regime
snippets: A spokesperson for BNP Paribas said in an email the result “is clearly wrong and there are very strong grounds to appeal the verdict.”

A federal jury in New York has issued a nearly $21 million verdict against France’s largest bank for giving the Sudanese government access to the U.S. financial system as it engaged in atrocities two decades ago. The woman and two men who obtained the verdict against BNP Paribas S.A. are U.S. citize
titles: U.S. jury issues $20 million verdict against France’s largest bank over Sudanese atrocities
US jury issues $20M verdict against French bank BNP Paribas over Sudanese atrocities
summary: A federal jury in New York awarded nearly $21 million to three U.S. citizens against BNP Paribas for enabling the Sudanese government's access to the U.S. financial system during atrocities two decades ago. BNP Paribas, France's largest bank, plans to appeal, stating the verdict is "clearly wrong."

title: Mariners One Win from First AL Pennant After Game 5 Victory
snippets: The Seattle Mariners have never been this close to reaching the World Series. It still feels distant to pitcher Logan Gilbert. “We’re still a long ways away,” Gilbert said Saturday, the day after a 6-2 comeback victory in Game 5 that put Seattle one win away from its first American League pennant.
The Seattle Mariners will start the star right-hander in Game 6 of the American League Championship Series against the Blue Jays.
titles: One win from first World Series, Mariners send Gilbert to mound in ALCS Game 6 at Toronto
Mariners’ Logan Gilbert to start Game 6 of ALCS vs. Blue Jays
summary: The Seattle Mariners are one win away from their first American League pennant after a 6-2 comeback victory in Game 5 against the Blue Jays. Despite the proximity to reaching the World Series, pitcher Logan Gilbert feels the team is still a long way off. Gilbert is set to start in Game 6 of the Championship Series for the Mariners.

title: China's Economy Hits Yearly Low Despite Export Surge
snippets: Chinese Export Boom Can’t Stop Economy’s Slowdown Bloomberg.com
China’s economy probably grew at the slowest in a year during the third quarter despite a boom in exports, in a disconnect the Communist Party may move to rectify at a key meeting in the coming week.
titles: Chinese Export Boom Can’t Stop Economy’s Slowdown - Bloomberg.com
Chinese Export Boom Can’t Stop Economy’s Slowdown
summary: China's economy experienced its slowest growth in a year during the third quarter, even amidst a surge in exports. This economic slowdown is occurring despite the export boom, and the Communist Party is expected to address this issue in a key meeting next week.

titles: Trump’s immigration crackdown weighs heavy on the US labor market - AP News

Despite her modest income, it suffices for her basic living expenses. The crackdown's broader implications on labor availability and economic contributions are implied.
